results.title: Shinto
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Religions of the world”.
Shinto, the indigenous religion of Japan, is one of the world’s oldest religious traditions and currently has around sixty-two million followers. It is rooted in mythology and folk rituals that have been passed down through the generations and although it has no congressional worship, founder, or written doctrine, it has at times served to unify Japan as a nation and to mobilise the country politically. Narrated by Ben Kingsley this video describes the social codes and daily life of its followers.

results.title: Judaism: the religion of a people
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Religions of the world”.
The religious practices and laws of Judaism have been handed down intact over many milleniums. This program looks at the foundations of Jewish teaching and laws as well as giving insight into the history of the Jewish people and their struggle to keep their identity and homeland.

results.title: Islam: the faith and the people
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Religions of the world”.
Islam is the world’s fastest growing religion and embraced by one out of every five people on earth. The program looks at the Islamic faith in comtemporary society as well as it’s history and the Prophet Mohammed. Also featured is a discussion of art and science in the Islamic faith.

results.title: Hinduism: an ancient path in the modern world
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Religions of the world”.
The program covers the characteristics and origins of Hinduism, a religion with no single founder and no defined organisation. Hinduism is an ancient path in the modern world with roots that stretch back before the dawn of recorded time. The program also looks at how the caste system operates as part of Indian society.

results.title: Buddhism: the middle way of compassion
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Religions of the world”.
A compassionate view of life, Buddhism has had a profound influence on the philosophical and political development of the nations of Asia. People in the West are becoming increasingly attracted to Buddhism and there are over 250 million followers. This episode looks at the life of the Buddha and at different types of Buddhist beliefs.

results.title: Ancient religions of the Mediterranean
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Religions of the world”.
This documentary turns its focus back into history to examine the diverse spiritual traditions of ancient Mediterranean cultures, and offer insight as to how the rituals and belief systems of these societies may have influenced modern religions such as Christianity, Islam and Judaism. Humanity’s basic desire to co-exist in harmony with the natural world was one of the primary factors involved with the increasing worship and deification of animal spirits. Agricultural advances saw wild animals - and therefore, wild spirits - being simultaneously domesticated. Gods and goddesses portrayed in a more accessible human form, or in a human form merged with that of an animal, grew in popularity. From Mesopotamia and Egypt to the Greek and Roman empires, different forms of worship, underpinned by similar archetypal myths and images, flourished and expanded. Narrated by Ben Kingsley. Includes teacher’s notes.

results.title: Kick Drum Mayhem!
results.creator_credit: Adam Hunt, Zeyu Li, Darrin Verhagen and Shinjuku Thief
results.brief_description: The music in ‘Kick Drum Mayhem!’ was inspired by a Black Lung distorted kick drum and then given the Shinjuku Thief treatment with Korean percussion and Wagnerian brass. The end result is so overblown that it was felt that it could provide an interesting counterweight for the zany playfulness of Ivan Gaal’s ‘Applause Please’ from 1974. Freshly edited for the millennial attention span.

results.title: Shinjuku Thief Remixes
results.brief_description: Supported by the City of Melbourne COVID-19 arts grants, this project engaged composers, sound designers and video editors to experiment and remix ACMI archive footage. A bold piece of music inspires a conceptual pairing from the collection, the elements of which are then carefully assembled into a microstructural puzzle of tight gestural relationships.

results.title: Salsa Catastrophe
results.creator_credit: Zeyu Li, Darrin Verhagen and Shinjuku Thief
results.brief_description: The music in ‘Salsa Catastrophe’ was inspired by Cuban musical glee and paired with the 1958 film ‘The Car Stealers’ – an admonition from the Council of Fire and Accident underwriters about the inevitability of youthful idleness leading to crime. The smashup of those two seemingly unrelated components provides an initial provocation and relied on meticulously constructed audiovisual logic to knit them together.

results.title: Route 75
results.creator_credit: Zeyu Li, Darrin Verhagen and Shinjuku Thief
results.brief_description: This episode in the series revists some intense footage captured by Ivan Gaal (1975) at the Camberwell six-way intersection before lights were eventually installed. A remix by Shinjuku Thief of an Amnion noise track from the “Maelstrom” album propels us through the mayhem.
